Message.Title: Follow the Cash
Message.Msg: Sales growth keeps stock moving upward. Cash balance will ultimately determine the stocks fate. Great companies produces lots of cash and companies like Apple have a hard time hiding the earnings because of all the cash generated by the organization. Amazon has the opposite problem - net cash declining every year, every quarter. Cash plus receivables less payables and accrued expenses last 5 quarters. Net Cash(3,959) (2,960) (2,749)(1,156) (252) More in the hole every quarter. But the gross margin is expanding - so everything will be okay right? Wrong. Taking short term working capital and investing in long term assets will not result in greater cash generation in the futures because of low return on investment of those invested assets. Same day delivery will be costly from every perspective and unless Walmart/Costco/myriad other on-line retailers/etc all decide to fold at once - pricing competition will be fierce. End result - consumers win and retailers and their stockholders loose. See airline industry for the playbook on how this works. After 2Q results for amzn we see a stock that is so far over its skis that a hard landing in not highly probable it is absolutely certain.
"End result - consumers win and retailers and their stockholders loose" I'll add a winner: insiders who get to sell at marvelous price multiples over the market on the heavy support of runnups.

There was a similar pattern in 2005-2006 during what was also an investment cycle. Naturally cash flow drops when you are engaged in large spending programs. But those who realized that ROIC getting cut in half during that time also realized it would go up and by a lot after the investment cycle eased. Not only did ROIC go way up mere quarters later, but it exceeded the previous high (44%) by a relative 25%. Those who held onto their shares even as ROIC and cash flow was decreasing (shares were $35 then) saw a gain of 160% as the stock went over $91 in 4Q07. So what pays is not to know where the cash flow trend has been. When a company is investing and spending large we all know what that will be. It is to know where cash flow will be AFTER the spending eases, because most of the upside, as in the cycle I describe above, was baked in by the time knowledge of the record levels of cash flow were finally reported.
